lines.gurmukhi: siqgur AwigAw pRiqpwlk bwlk isK crn kml rj mihmw Apwr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Aagiaa Pratipaalak Baalak Sikha , Charan Kamal Raj Mahimaa Apaar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A devotee who obeys the command of the True Guru with the innocence of a child, the glory of the dust of his feet is infinite.

lines.gurmukhi: isv snkwidk bHmwidk n gMimqw hY ingm syKwid nyq nyq kY aucwr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Siv Sanakaadik Brahamaadik N Ganmitaa Hai , Nigam Saykhaadi Nayt Nayt Kai Ouchaar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Shiv, Sanak etc., the four sons of Brahma and other gods of Hindu triology cannot reach the praise of the Sikh of Guru who obeys the command of doing Naam Simran. Even the Vedas and Shesh Naag praise the glory of such a disciple saying-great, limitless.

lines.gurmukhi: cqur pdwrQ qiRkwl qiRBvn cwhY jog Bog sursr srDw sMswr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Chatur Padaarad Trikaal Tribhavan Chaahai , Jog Bhog Surasar Saradhaa Sansaar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: All the four desirable goals-dharam, arth, kam and mokh, three times (past, present and future) desire refuge of such a devotee. The Yogis, householders, river Ganges the river of the gods and the whole world devotion craves for the dust of the feet of su

lines.gurmukhi: pUjn ky pUj Aru pwvn pivqR krY AkQ kQw bIcwr ibml ibQwr hY ]180]
lines.transliteration_english: Poojan Kay Pooj Aru Paavan Pavitr Karai , Akad Kadaa Beechaar Bimal Bidaar Hai ?180?

Shabad OS B.translation: The dust of the feet of a disciple of the True Guru blessed with the Naam Simran is sacred even for those who are believed to be pious souls as it purifies them further. The state of such a person is beyond elucidation and his views are pure and clear. (1
